column1: #Text=Kenyan humanitarian crisis deepens as talks continue
#Text=In Kenya , the government and opposition have resumed talks on the dispute over the elections that sparked a month-long wave of violence .
#Text=Relief officials say the humanitarian toll continues to rise and are calling for a speedy solution .
#Text=Relief officials appealed to political leaders to stabilize security throughout Kenya as the number of people fleeing violence in some parts of the country continued to rise .
#Text=A Kenya Red Cross spokesman , Tony Mwangi , says the instability is aggravating the humanitarian crisis .

#Text=" There are a lot of areas that require immediate assistance in the form of food as well as shelter for freshly displaced people and this is mostly in the western region of the country and a bit of the Rift Valley , " Mwangi said .

column1: #Text=Nearly 100 people have been killed in the violence in the past several days , mostly in western Kenya .
#Text=The Red Cross says as a result the death toll has risen to about 1,000 and the number of homeless has grown to more than 300,000 .
#Text=Mwangi said his organization has provided some assistance to most of the displaced in the country but not enough .
#Text=He said security was an essential condition for the efficient distribution of aid .
#Text=" Our humanitarian response moves a lot faster when security is available .
